aicpa-topic.title: Terms Used to Define Professional Requirements in This AICPA Guide

body.p: The requirements described in this guide are normally referenced to the relevant, applicable GAAP standards or regulations from which they are derived. Generally, the terms used in this guide describing the professional requirements of the referenced standard setter (for example, the SEC) are the same as those used in the applicable standards or regulations (for example, must or should). However, where the accounting requirements are derived from the FASB ASC, this guide uses should, whereas FASB uses shall. In its resource document “About the Codification” that accompanies the FASB ASC, FASB states that it considers the terms should and shall to be comparable terms and to represent the same concept — the requirement to apply a standard.

Readers should refer to the relevant applicable standards and regulations for more information on the requirements imposed by the use of the various terms that define professional requirements in the context of the standards and regulations in which they appear.

Certain exceptions apply to these general rules, particularly in those circumstances in which the guide describes prevailing or preferred industry practices for the application of a standard or regulation. In these circumstances, the applicable senior committee responsible for reviewing the guide’s content believes the guidance contained herein is appropriate for the circumstances.
